page.title: 08COMMUNITY FARMING IN ERSKINE
page.content: Lamont Farm in Erskine was opened in 1979. It is a community farm which is open to the public. The farm is run by volunteer workers and depends on donations from visitors to finance the feeding of the animals. It gives children the opportunity to sample farm life by taking part in chores such as feeding the animals and cleaning out the sheds. The farm is visited by many of the local schools because of its educational value and some of the children spend their holidays working on the farm. It occupies approximately 5 acres of land and has become a home for a variety of animals such as, horses, cows, sheep, hens, rabbits and a fox. Bees are also kept and the honey is sold. Vegetables can also be bought at Lamont Farm. A picnic area is provided for the many visitors.
